definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: How can you use public relations as a district-level membership tool?

sentences.english: The feat would be both a technological and public relations triumph.

sentences.english: There are only four of us. We take care of all in-house and extemal communications and public relations.

sentences.english: The non-profitable organizations in China have started to pay close attention to public relations in recent years.
